Class Scorecard

  • java.lang.Object
    • Scorecard

  • public class Scorecard
extends java.lang.Object
    This program uses the Hand class to display a player's scorecard as well as their scoring options. The player's scorecard and scoring options update after each hand. The methods in this class also add components to various JFrames CPSC 224-01, Spring 2020 Homework #4 No Sources to cite
    Version:
    v4.0 03/26/20
    Author:
    Eric Gustin

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Hand hand
      hand represents the Hand object passed to the Scorecard class
      private java.util.ArrayList<javax.swing.JToggleButton> lineButtons 
      private int lines_left
      lines_left keeps track of the number of lines yet to be chosen
      private int[] lower_potential_scores
      upper_potential_scores represents the current hand's potential scoring options for each lower line
      private java.lang.String[] lower_scorecard
      lower_scorecard is an array that holds each lower line's code, selected status, and points awarded if selected.
      private int lower_total
      lower_total represents the player's total score for the lower region of the scorecard
      private Player player
      player represents the Player object
      private int pts_to_get_bonus
      pts_to_get_bonus is the summation of the number of sides on a die multiplied by 3
      private int[] upper_potential_scores
      upper_potential_scores represents the current hand's potential scoring options for each upper line
      private java.lang.String[] upper_scorecard
      upper_scorecard is an array that holds each upper line's code, selected status, and points awarded if selected.
      private int upper_total
      upper_total represents the player's total score for the upper region of the scorecard

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void displayScorecard(ScorecardGUI scorecardGUI, GameOverGUI gameOverGUI)
      displayScorecard displays the player's upper and lower scorecard for the current Yahtzee game.
      void displayScoringOptions(ScoringOptionsGUI scoringOptionsGUI)
      displayScoringOptions displays the scoring options for a player after a full hand has been played.
      private void findPickCode(ScoringOptionsGUI scoringOptionsGUI)
      The findPickCode method finds the line that the user selected to score on, and saves this selection in an array If this method is called, and there are no more lines left to score on, then the game is over and a GameOverGUI is created.
      int getLinesLeft()
      getLinesLeft is a getter function for the lines_left variable

    • Field Detail

      • upper_total

        private int upper_total
        upper_total represents the player's total score for the upper region of the scorecard

      • lower_total

        private int lower_total
        lower_total represents the player's total score for the lower region of the scorecard

      • upper_scorecard

        private java.lang.String[] upper_scorecard
        upper_scorecard is an array that holds each upper line's code, selected status, and points awarded if selected. Each element in upper_scorecard follows the format of "code,selected status,points award if selected"

      • lower_scorecard

        private java.lang.String[] lower_scorecard
        lower_scorecard is an array that holds each lower line's code, selected status, and points awarded if selected. Each element in lower_scorecard follows the format of "code,selected status,points award if selected"

      • upper_potential_scores

        private int[] upper_potential_scores
        upper_potential_scores represents the current hand's potential scoring options for each upper line

      • lower_potential_scores

        private int[] lower_potential_scores
        upper_potential_scores represents the current hand's potential scoring options for each lower line

      • hand

        private Hand hand
        hand represents the Hand object passed to the Scorecard class

      • player

        private Player player
        player represents the Player object

      • lines_left

        private int lines_left
        lines_left keeps track of the number of lines yet to be chosen

      • pts_to_get_bonus

        private int pts_to_get_bonus
        pts_to_get_bonus is the summation of the number of sides on a die multiplied by 3

      • lineButtons

        private java.util.ArrayList<javax.swing.JToggleButton> lineButtons

    • Constructor Detail

      • Scorecard

        public Scorecard(Hand hand_object,
                 Player player_object)
        Scorecard is the constructor for the Scorecard class. Initializes hand, upper_total, lower_total, upper_scorecard, lower_scorecard, lines_left, upper_potential_scores, lower_potential_scores
        Parameters:
        hand_object - represents the Hand object that will determine the scoring
        player_object - represents the Player object that

    • Method Detail

      • getLinesLeft

        public int getLinesLeft()
        getLinesLeft is a getter function for the lines_left variable
        Returns:
        lines_left

      • displayScorecard

        public void displayScorecard(ScorecardGUI scorecardGUI,
                             GameOverGUI gameOverGUI)
        displayScorecard displays the player's upper and lower scorecard for the current Yahtzee game. This method has two cases. 1. Add components to the gameOverGUI. 2. Add components to the scorecardGUI's getPlayerMainGUI
        Parameters:
        scorecardGUI - represents the ScorecardGUI
        gameOverGUI - represents the gameOverGUI

      • displayScoringOptions

        public void displayScoringOptions(ScoringOptionsGUI scoringOptionsGUI)
        displayScoringOptions displays the scoring options for a player after a full hand has been played. If a line is selected, then it will not appear for the rest of the game
        Parameters:
        scoringOptionsGUI - represents the ScoringOptions object

      • findPickCode

        private void findPickCode(ScoringOptionsGUI scoringOptionsGUI)
        The findPickCode method finds the line that the user selected to score on, and saves this selection in an array If this method is called, and there are no more lines left to score on, then the game is over and a GameOverGUI is created. Otherwise, the method creates a PlayerMainGUI object
        Parameters:
        scoringOptionsGUI - represents the ScoringOptionsGUI object
